result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario T. Ostrum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mario T. Ostrum is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mario T. Ostrum was found guilty of 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

supervisions.notes: While incarcerated 25% of the inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA evaluation and comply as deemed necessary.

Counseling deemed necessary.

Absolute sobriety.   Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.

No contact with E.E.B. or family or residence.

No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 with prior agent approval, except for his own children.

Submit a DNA sample within 30 days.

Comply with Sex Offender Registry.

Attend Sex Offender assessments and treatment.

supervisions.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

11:42 Attorney Eric Sheets in court.  David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is inquiring about count 1, which was a hung jury. State moves to dismiss count 1 without prejudice.
Court dismisses count 1 without prejudice.
Attorney Sheets requests that cash bond be released since count 1 is now dismissed. State does not object.
Court orders that remaining bond be returned to poster.

records.addlTxt:
10:55 Defendant Mario T. Ostrum in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Defendant Mario T. Ostrum in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addresses incident where a pill fell off the defendant's person when being brought up from the jail. Court questions if defendant is in a clear mind to proceed with sentencing. Attorney Sheets makes statement and feels defendant is in clear mind and wishes to proceed with sentencing. 
Both parties have received the PSI. Parties make oral corrections to PSI. Victim's rights have been complied with. Victim's statements are made. 
Attorney Knaapen makes statement and recommendation for 40 years WSP, 20 years ITC and 20 years ES and other conditions listed in PSI.
Attorney Sheets makes statement and recommendation of 7 years WSP, 3 years ITC and 4 years ES.
Defendant makes statement. 
Court sentences defendant to 15 years WSP, 9 years ITC and 6 years ES. Court adopts recommendations included in PSI. 250 days credit.
in support from Audrey Anne Houghton
of support from Amanda Waddington

Darla Allen, re: Mario
Bernadine Engwall re: Mario

Pat Martinson, re: Mario
Garth J Winker re: Mario
Mary Martinson re: Mario

records.descr: Satisfaction of mortgage for property bond posted

records.addlTxt: from Court ordering release of surety bond. Cash bond will be held until time of sentencing.
from M.M. requesting return of cash bond and release of surety bond

Exhibits #1-2 - VIDEOS IN CRIMINAL EXHIBIT DRAWER
Exhibits #3-4 - DIAGRAMS
Jury Questions
List of Jurors and Alternate
JURY TRIAL WITNESS FEES - $282.80

8:03 Defendant Mario T. Ostrum in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court opens without presence of jury. Court advises parties after research, he did not make a ruling on the videotapes of alleged victim's statements. 
J.S. is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. He is the father of F.S. F.S. has been living with him since the alleged incident was reported.  Attorney Sheets requests sequestration. Court denies sequestration regarding testimony on videotapes. Witness states that F.S. is reluctant to talk about the incidents. He indicates that J.O. has not had any contact with F.S. since this alleged incident was reported. Testifies as to F.S.'s behavior when the subject of trial comes up.
8:15 Attorney Sheets cross-examines witness.  
8:20 Attorney Knaapen makes statement and feels that F.S.'s videotaped interview should be admissible.  Attorney Sheets makes statement and asks Court to not allow videtape. Court finds videotape to be admissible with cross-examination.
8:34 J.B. is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. She is E.B.'s mother. She states that E.B. did not want to go to the videotaped interview at the Marshfield Advocacy Center on 1/2/14. Testifies as to her behavior after the alleged incident. She states that E.B. was a very outgoing person before the alleged incident. She testifies as to how her behavior has changed since the alleged incident. She testifies as to E.B.'s relationship with J.O.
8:47 Attorney Sheets cross-examines witness.  
8:51 Attorney Knaapen makes statement and feels the videotape of E.B. should be admissible. Attorney Sheets makes statement and feels that videotaped interview of E.B. should not be allowed during trial. Court finds videotape will be admissible with cross-examination.
Attorney Sheets asks that E.B.'s biological parents not be disclosed during testimony. Attorney Knaapen states that he did not intend to address it. Attorney Knaapen will advise his witnesses. Attorney Knaapen states that it may be subject to cross examination of J.O. Court says it will be dealt with at that time if it occurs.
9:10 Court in recess.
9:28 Court reconvenes with presence of jury. Attorney Knaapen moves for admission of exhibit #1. No objection. Exhibit is received.
Sara McCormick is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. She states that she arranged a forensic interview with E.B. at the same time as F.S.  Exhibit #2 is marked and played for the jury. 
10:07 E.B. is sworn as a witness and cross-examined by Attorney Sheets. She testifies as to her recollection of the alleged incident. 
10:29 Attorney Knaapen cross-examines witness. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. 
10:37 Attorney Sheets cross-examines witness.  
10:38 Attorney Knaapen cross-examines witness.  
10:39 Jury in recess. Court adds to his previous ruling this morning regarding videotapes.
10:41 Court in recess.
10:55 Court reconvenes with presence of jury. Attorney Knaapen questions witness Sara McCormick.  Testifies as to her impressions of the video of the child forensic interviews. She states that she arrested defendant on 1/6/14. She states the defendant left the state and was gone for approximately 3 years. She located him in California because of a police contact. Exhibits #3 & 4 are marked and reviewed with witness.  Exhibits #2-4 are received. Exhibits #3 & 4 are published to the jury.
11:03 Attorney Sheets cross-examines witness.
11:24 Jury in recess. Objection is discussed. Court sustains objection.
11:32 Jury is brought back into courtroom. Attorney Sheets continues to cross-examine witness. 
11:54 Attorney Knaapen redirects. Testifies as to results of F.S.'s physical examination and interview training and procedures. 
12:11 Attorney Sheets cross-examines witness.  Testifies as to her interview with the defendant and his denial of the accusations. 
12:24 Attorney Knaapen redirects. 
12:26 Attorney Sheets cross-examines witness. 
12:27 Court in recess.
1:31 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. State intends to rest. Attorney Sheets says they do not have any witnesses. Court questions defendant regarding his right to testify or not to testify. He states he does not wish to testify and it is his decision. 
1:36 Jury is brought into courtroom. State rests. Defense rests. Juror #1437 is alternate and excused. 
1:39 Court in recess.
2:22 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Attorney Knaapen moves to amend count 2 to attempted 1st degree sexual assault. Defense objects to amendment as he feels it is prejudical to defendant. Court questions defendant if he understands that his attorney is objecting to a lesser charge. He understands and he agrees with his attorney. Court finds that amendment would be prejudical and denies amendment. 
Court puts jury instruction conference on the record. 
2:54 Jurors are brought back into courtroom. Court reads jury instructions.
3:06 Attorney Knaapen gives closing statement. 
3:29 Attorney Sheets gives closing statement.
3:56 Attorney Knaapen gives closing rebuttal statement. 
4:10 Court gives closing jury instructions.
4:15 Bailiffs Dave Hoks and Carl Lemke are sworn as court officers and jurors retire to deliberate. Exhibits will only be given to jury if requested. Court advises defendant that he must remain on the premises of the courthouse.
4:17 Court in recess.
5:51 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Court discusses written question from the jury. Attorney Knaapen states that if the jury wishes to see the videotapes of the forensic interviews, that they be required to come back into courtroom to view the videos. Transcripts of testimony would not be available. Attorney Sheets agrees that there are no transcripts available. He objects to having jury watching videos again. Court will bring jury back into courtroom and advise them that they have to rely on their recollection of the trial and no transcripts will be given and they may not watch the videos again.
6:01 Jury is brought back into courtroom. Court advises jury that there is no video of testimony on the witness stand and no transcripts are available to them. Court also advises them that they will not be allowed to watch videos again.
6:05 Jurors retire back to jury room to deliberate.
6:38 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Jury has sent a note to the Court saying that they cannot come to a decision on one count. Parties agree that Court can accept verdict on two count and declare hung jury on count one. Parties feel that Court should encourage the jury to continue deliberations on count one.
6:42 Jury is brought into courtroom. Court reads jury instruction and advises jurors that they will be returned to the jury room to continue deliberations.
6:44 Jurors retire to continue deliberations.
7:27 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Jurors have sent note to the Court saying that they have reached a verdict on count 2, but are deadlocked on count 1. Court discusses options with attorneys. Attorney Sheets states that defendant is willing to accept verdict on count 2 and mistrial on count 1. After further discussion with defendant, Attorney Sheets asks that Court instruct jury to continue to deliberate. Attorney Knaapen states that he feels Court should ask jury if they feel further deliberations would be successful with the possibility of continuing deliberations tomorrow. Court formulated a response to sent back to the jury.
7:40 Court in recess.
7:50 Jury sends written answer indicating that they will not be able to come to a unanimous verdict on count one. Attorney Knaapen asks that Court allow the jury to view the videos to help them break their deadlock. Attorney Sheets opposes that and wishes to abide by Court's previous ruling.  Court will bring in jury and accept verdict on count 2.
7:57 Jurors are brought into courtoom. Jurors return of verdict of guilty on count 2 and are deadlocked on count 1. Court polls the jury individually and they each state this is their verdict. 
8:03 Jury is dismissed. Attorney Knaapen asks Court to enter guilty verdict on count 2. Court enters judgment of guilt. Court declares mistrial on count 1. Court revokes bond and orders PSI.  Sentencing and motions are set for February 2, 2018 at 10:30 a.m.
Preliminary

9:06 Defendant Mario T. Ostrum in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court puts on record issue with juror #2148.
Defense motions in limine. #1 - Attorney Knaapen states that he will be presenting evidence that delay in prosecution was because defendant fled the State and had to be extradited from California. Attorney Sheets feels that these facts should not be presented to the jury. Attorney Knaapen feels it is relevant as defendant was using an alias in California. He indicates that they are arguing regarding the weight of the information. Attorney Sheets makes additional statement. Court will allow the evidence that defendant left the area and where he was located. Court will not allow evidence that defendant was extradited or used an alias. Motion #2 - No objection and is granted. Motion #3 - Parties agree that if defendant testifies, he will testify that he has 3 prior criminal convictions, and motion is granted. Motion #4 - Witnesses & victims will be allowed to remain in courtroom to be introduced during voir dire and then will be required to leave courtroom. Motion #5 is discussed and is granted. 
9:32 Juror #2148 is brought into courtroom and questioned by the Court. Attorney Knaapen questions juror. Attorney Sheets questions juror. Juror is returned to jury room. Attorney Knaapen and Attorney Sheets ask that juror be disqualified as a juror. Court disqualifies juror #2148.
9:45 Court in recess.
9:51 Court reconvenes without presence of jury. Preliminary instructions are discussed.
9:55 Jurors are brought into courtroom and are sworn.
10:01 Twenty three juors are called to the box. Court begins voir dire. Juror #1438 is struck for cause. Juror #1422 is struck for cause. Juror #1436 struck for cause.
10:14 Attorney Knaapen does voir dire. Juror #1423 is struck for cause. 
10:46 Attorney Sheets does voir dire. 
11:07 Strikes are made. Court reads preliminary jury instructions.
11:20 Thirteen jurors are sworn.
11:23 Court in recess.
11:34 Court reconvenes with presence of jury. Attorney Knaapen gives opening statement. 
11:41 Attorney Sheets gives opening statement.
11:49 Jury in recess. Attorney Knaapen raises concern regarding comment made in defense's opening statement. Attorney Sheets responds to Attorney Knaapen's concerns. Court will allow Attorney Sheets to bring in evidence, but Court may revisit previous ruling regarding extradition.
11:53 Court in recess.
1:00 Court convenes without presence of jury.  Attorney Sheets advises Court of an incident during lunch hour that a juror stepped on the elevator when he and defendant were on. He states he stopped the elevator and he and defendant got off.
1:03 Jurors are brought into courtroom.  Doug Christianson is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. He is a deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. On 12/24/13, he was dispatched to a residence in the City of Nekoosa regarding a sexual assault to two children. He met with J.O., F.S. and E.B.  and interviewed them. J.O. advised him of both children reporting a sexual assault that occurred at a different residence. She stated she and defendant were playing a game with the two children and defendant was consuming alcohol. She then put the children to bed in the living room.  She stated that E.B. reported to her that she woke up and defendant was putting his hands up her pants. E.B. told J.O. that defendant had done the same thing to F.S. the day before. He interviewed the two children. He interviewed E.B. and she stated that when she was sleeping on the couch, she felt someone's hand going up her pant leg and touched her private area. She said the the person doing it was the defendant. She told F.W. and then they told J.O. the next morning, F.W. said the same thing has happened to her. He later spoke to F.S. and J.O. She told the same story as E.B. She stated that defendant did the same thing and this has happened to her before this incident at the same residence. He later spoke to Detective Sara McCormick who advised him to contact Human Services. 
1:27 Attorney Sheets cross-examines witness.  
1:56 Attorney Knaapen redirects. 
2:06 Attorney Sheets cross-examines witness.  
2:12 Court in recess.
2:26 Court reconvenes without presence of jury.  Attorney Knaapen questions procedure of calling witnesses and playing video. Matter is discussed. After video is played, children will be subject to cross-examination.
2:35 Jurors are brought back into courtroom. Sara McCormick is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Knaapen. She is an investigator with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. She is the juvenile affairs investigator. She is assigned to child sexual assault cases. She became involved in this case on 12/24/13. Testifies as to her training for forensic interviews. Testifies as to arrangements made to do a forensic interview with F.S.  She did the interview on 1/2/14 at the Marshfield Child Advocacy Center. The interview was video and audio recorded. Exhibit #1 is marked and played for the jury. Instruction 158 is read to jury before video is played. 
3:24 F.S. is sworn as a witness and cross-examined by Attorney Sheets. She states she is 14 years old now and the alleged incidents occurred when she was 10. She testifies as to the events of the evening of 12/23/13. She said she and E.B. woke her mom up and told her and then she told her mom that defendant had done this numerous times to her in the past. 
3:42 Attorney Knaapen redirects.  The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.  
3:47 Attorney Sheets cross-examines witness.  
3:51 Jury in recess. Court discusses with parties when the Court ruled that video of interviews with alleged victims was admissible.
3:58 Court in recess.
4:36 Court reconvenes without presences of jury. Jurors were released for the day during the recess.  Court notes that motion to admit videotapes was never heard and court did not rule on motion. Court will convene tomorrow at 8:00 without presence of jury and motion will be heard. Attorney Knaapen moves exhibit #1. Attorney Sheets has no objection. Subject to court's ruling tomorrow, exhibit is received.
4:43 Court in recess.

10:01 Defendant Mario T. Ostrum in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Defendant Mario T. Ostrum in custody.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Alleged victim appears by phone.
Attorney Sheets asks that Court reinstate $10,000 cash bond. Alleged victims address the court. State opposes any bond modifications. Attorney Sheets makes additional statement. 
Court modifies bond to $50,000 cash bond, $20,000 cash and $30,000 equity and property. Will be subject to EMP. May not leave the State of Wisconsin.

2:33 Attorney Eric Sheets appears by phone.  Leigh M Neville-Neil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Knaapen states that initial investigating officer would not be available for trial because of family health issues. He states the witness is necessary for the case. Alleged victims have been contacted and advised of the situation. He asks for adjournment of trial. 
Attorney Sheets states he has contacted the defendant in the jail. They are not happy about the request, but feel the witness is necessary and are not objecting to adjournment. He does wish to address bond, however.
Court finds good cause to adjourn trial and grants adjournment. Bond will be addressed at 10:00 a.m. tomorrow.

9:05 Defendant Mario T. Ostrum in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Sheets states that he cannot be ready for trial on May 22nd, but would be ready by early June.
After checking calendars, the first available dates are Sept. 19 & 20. Court grants adjournment. Court modifies bond to $100,000.
